text: Upon meeting with officials in Kyiv I am deeply moved by the strength and resolve of the Ukrainian people. Despite the relentless aggression from Russian forces, their courage and determination to defend their sovereignty and freedom is truly inspiring.

It was a pleasure meeting with Ambassador Julie Davis @USAmbCy in Kyiv this week. I commend her for her outstanding work in supporting President Trump's efforts to bring peace to Ukraine. Her dedication and tireless efforts are crucial in navigating the complex challenges of this conflict. Thank you, Ambassador Davis, and @USEmbassyKyiv staff, for your service and commitment to a peaceful resolution.

There is precedence for President Trump’s response and I fully support it. 

BBC: Turkey's downing of Russian warplane - what we know
https://t.co/eyVpykE2vR

On this Rosh Hashanah, I want to extend my warmest wishes for a sweet and prosperous New Year to all those observing this special time. May the coming year be filled with health, happiness, and peace. Shana Tova! https://t.co/aetlieC5BJ

I am horrified at the assassination of Charlie Kirk on September 10, 2025, and offer my deepest condolences to the Kirk family. I strongly support H. Res. 719, which honors Mr. Kirk's life and legacy, and I call on all civic leaders to reject political violence and engage in constructive civic discourse.

Happy 78th Birthday to the United States Air Force!
As the representative of Ohio's 10th District, home to Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, I am proud to celebrate the incredible service and dedication of our Airmen. Your commitment to defending our nation and pushing the boundaries of innovation is truly inspiring. Thank you for your service and dedication to excellence! 🇺🇸

The Ohio Defense and Aerospace Forum is an instrumental event that brings together senior government officials, military installations, industry leaders and academia. Now in its 10th year, the conversations and partnerships formed at this annual event reaffirm Ohio’s leading role in R&D of the national security solutions to present and future threats.

This Patriot Day as we reflect on the sacrifices made by our first responders, military personnel, and countless others, let us not forget the lessons learned. In a world that often feels divided, we must stand united against those who threaten our freedoms and way of life. 

Let us pledge to protect our democracy and uphold the values that make our country great. Stay vigilant, stay united, and may we never forget. 🇺🇸

I am horrified by the shooting of Charlie Kirk today at his event at Utah Valley University. 
Political violence has no place in our country and should be condemned in the strongest way possible by all. 
Join me in praying for Charlie and his family.

China's goal is clear: global dominance by 2049, starting in the Indo-Pacific. I recently returned from a bipartisan trip to Australia and Pacific Island Countries revealing the stark reality of Chinese economic coercion and military intimidation. The trip also showed the strength of our allies, who are stepping up to help counter this threat.
Read our full joint Op-Ed here: https://t.co/QfCoHOUva2

Four years ago today, we lost 13 brave servicemembers at Abbey Gate in Kabul. 

These heroes gave their lives protecting others during a tragic and chaotic evacuation. They saved countless lives and we honor their sacrifice.

Their courage will never be forgotten. 

- Marine Corps LCpl. David L. Espinoza, 20
- Marine Corps Cpl. Hunter Lopez, 22
- Marine Corps LCpl. Kareem M. Nikoui, 20
- Marine Corps Sgt. Nicole L. Gee, 23
- Marine Corps SSgt. Darin T. Hoover, 31
- Army Staff Sgt. Ryan C. Knauss, 23
- Marine Corps LCpl. Rylee J. McCollum, 20
- Marine Corps LCpl. Dylan R. Merola, 20
- Marine Corps Sgt. Johanny Rosario Pichardo, 25
- Marine Corps Cpl. Humberto A. Sanchez, 22
- Marine Corps Lance Cpl. Jared M. Schmitz, 20
- Navy Corpsman Maxton W. Soviak, 22
- Marine Corps Cpl. Daegan W. Page, 23

Today, we express our deepest gratitude to the men and women who have received the Purple Heart award due to being wounded or killed in service to our nation.

May we always honor their sacrifices and uphold the values they fought to defend. https://t.co/4SzdlEtMFL

Today, we celebrate the 235th anniversary of the founding of the U.S. Coast Guard.

The Coast Guard is essential to our national security, law enforcement and disaster response.

Let us honor their steadfast service and their enduring commitment to the American people. https://t.co/pyfSpzvCLP

I appreciated the great opportunity to spend past few days with @usairforce Secretary Meink in the Indo-Pacific theatre. His background and expertise are perfect for this challenging security situation.

Pleased to meet again with Dr. Derrick Foward, President of the Dayton Branch NAACP, and Mrs. Tiwona Foward to discuss key federal issues impacting the greater Dayton community. https://t.co/5Hr2IepyqY

Public transit is a critical resource for millions of Americans. However, rising bus procurement costs make it increasingly difficult for cities and towns to provide this essential service to their communities.

That's why I joined @RepMaxwellFrost in introducing the Transit Bus Affordability Act, which authorizes the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to examine the rising procurement costs of transit buses across the United States.

Every American has the right to use banking services in a way that works best for them. In recent years, financial institutions have been aggressively advocating for paperless and electronic bank statements, policies that would disenfranchise many customers.

That's why I introduced the PAPER Act. This bill would prohibit financial institutions from requiring customers to use paperless statements.

Ukraine’s survival requires reliable shipments of weapons and ammunition. Unauthorized pauses in military support, as recently occurred by the Defense Department, jeopardize lives in the war against Russian aggression and undermines the trust and reliability of our partners in the United States.

My amendment to the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) provides real oversight into our military aid shipments.

Read my release here: https://t.co/J8A6uzxtzK

Would you like to order a flag that was flown over the Capitol building?
You can order one from my website at https://t.co/4Vu4RmLUIP. https://t.co/tq4n9wDb6O

If you are having issues with the Social Security Administration, my office is here to help!
Visit my website at https://t.co/4Vu4RmLmTh or call my Dayton office at (937)-225-2843 for assistance with the Social Security Administration. https://t.co/4EyP53eKfi

Are you seeking a nomination for a service academy?

If you are planning a trip to Washington, D.C. and would like to schedule a tour of the White House, Capitol Building, FBI Building, or the Bureau of Engraving and Printing, visit my website at https://t.co/PbDSrcfmPN or call my Washington, D.C. office at (202)-225-6465 for help scheduling those tours.

Happy Independence Day to everyone in the Miami Valley.

Today, may we take a moment to reflect on the incredible gift of freedom and the enduring strength of the American Spirit. https://t.co/s2KTlwTXNv

Russian aggression is not a distant threat. Their war against Ukraine is an attack on the democratic values of Europe and the United States. 

Today, on @TheArenaCNN, I told @kasie that we should provide both Ukraine and President Trump the tools they need to combat Russian aggression and end this war.
🚨TUNE IN - Joining @TheArenaCNN at 445pm to discuss latest developments on Iran & the U.S. policy in the Middle East. 🚨
A closing reminder of NATO PA in Dayton & our community’s return to the international stage https://t.co/HaBEju0lHx

During the Spring 2025 Session of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly in Dayton, @sarfil1923  and @DaytonPhil  performed at the "Concert for Peace," which was conducted by the world-renowned conductor, @marinalsop.
Their performance in Dayton was part of the ceremonies commemorating the 30th anniversary of the Dayton Peace Accords, which brought peace and stability to Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Balkans.
Today, Dayton's own Discover Classical will be airing a recording of the "Concert for Peace". Tune in at 88.1, 89.1, or 89.9 on FM radio, or by clicking this link to experience this historical concert.
https://t.co/ym7gPJbpbW

I joined Caitríona Perry on BBC America to discuss the latest news regarding the United States' strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities and potential peace talks with Iran.

Watch the full interview here:
https://t.co/nQd6RO9T0Q

🚨Joining @BBCAMERICA at 5:05pm to discuss the latest assessments of the successful U.S. military strike against Iran’s nuclear facilities & what diplomatic steps are next. Tune In. https://t.co/gvwJO9QLX6

I joined Julie Mason on SiriusXM's @JulieMasonShow1  to discuss the strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, the rising threat of China in their alliance with Iran, and the increase in NATO defense spending at the NATO Summit in The Hague.

Listen to the full interview here: 
https://t.co/ONIJir0eeO

I joined @RepAnnWagner, @RepWesleyBellMO and @RepAuchincloss to introduce the Upholding the Dayton Peace Agreement Through Sanctions Act.

This bipartisan piece of legislation would mandate sanctions on foreign persons who undermine the Dayton Peace Agreement or otherwise threaten the stability of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

The United States must continue to stand with the people of Bosnia and Herzegovina to protect their sovereignty, support democratic institutions, and ensure that the hard-won peace of Dayton is never undone.

Today, I joined @KateBolduan on @NewsCentralCNN where we discussed the strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities and why Iran’s leaders remain in hiding.

Watch the full interview here:
https://t.co/hcrqRQNrcj
🚨 TUNE IN 🚨 - joining @CNN @KateBolduan at 930am to talk the latest news following the successful military strike on 3 of Iran’s nuclear facilities. https://t.co/Fcrlgd3bCB

Statement of the U.S. Delegation to @natopapress in support of @NATO Allies committing to 5% of GDP target for defense spending annually. 

As Head of U.S. Delegation, I applaud strong leadership of President Trump in convincing our European & Canadian partners of their shared responsibilities to peace and security, not just in words but of investments in collective defense.

TUNE IN: Joining @Phil_Mattingly on @CNN at 6:05pm to talk about President Trump’s successful military strike on key nuclear facilities in Iran and the need for Iranians to return to diplomatic negotiations for a lasting peace. https://t.co/jiwSSfE1QC

The successful military operation to impede the Iranian regime from obtaining a nuclear weapon by President Trump and our Men and Women in uniform follows the efforts of the President’s “maximum pressure campaign” during the first term and his attempts at direct diplomacy this term to persuade the Iranian regime to abandon its nuclear weapon ambitions that threatened the United States and Israel. 

Now we must confirm that no hidden legacy elements of the Iranian nuclear program remain viable that might permit Iranian nuclear ambitions to be achievable.

Honored to recognize nine outstanding Miami Valley students who have earned appointments to U.S. Service Academies!

These future leaders are heading to West Point, the Naval Academy, and the Air Force Academy and are answering the call to serve our nation with courage and dedication.

Congratulations to Brendan, Samaria, Audrey, Macie, Samuel, Jia, Tucker, Owen & Benjamin.

Israel, our strong ally in the region, has the inherent right to exist. President Trump has negotiated in good faith for a diplomatic solution with the goal that Iran never achieves a nuclear weapon. In response, Iran has chosen to further develop their nuclear weapons and ballistic missiles programs. Under continued threat, Israel has taken action to protect its citizens.

Today, I questioned Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth about the need for modernizing our nuclear weapons and developing a comprehensive missile defense program as threats increase from hostile nations, including Russia’s intent to place a nuclear anti-satellite weapon in space.

Watch the interaction here:

I was able to meet and personally congratulate Ravyn Strozier from Stivers School For The Arts, the winner of the Congressional Art Competition from Ohio's Tenth District.

Ravyn's piece, a mixed media self-portrait titled, "As sweet as a honey bee" depicts trypophobia, the fear of holes or clusters through honeycombs.

Today’s news from Ahmedabad is deeply saddening. My thoughts and prayers are with the families of the victims of Air India flight 171. The U.S. stands ready to support our ally India in this dark hour.

Today, I was honored to meet Aswat Sivakumar from Centerville High School, who is participating in the Gold Medal Summit in Washington, D.C.

Aswat received a Gold Medal from the Congressional Award program for excelling in volunteerism, character development, and physical fitness.

81 years ago today, Allied forces launched the largest amphibious military operation in history.

Let us pause and honor the extraordinary courage and sacrifice of those who fought for freedom on D-Day. https://t.co/cU1W9IjKzU

Tonight, the Sarajevo Philharmonic joins the Dayton Philharmonic for a powerful "Concert for Peace" at the Schuster Center, conducted by the world-renowned @MarinAlsop.

This marks the Sarajevo Philharmonic’s only U.S. performance on their tour — a profound cultural moment for our community.

As we reflect on the 30th anniversary of the Dayton Peace Accords, let this concert serve as a tribute to what was achieved in the Balkans and a renewed commitment to peace.

On this Memorial Day, we pause to remember the heroes who made the ultimate sacrifice for our freedoms. 

We honor the fallen with humility, gratitude, and a steadfast promise to never forget. https://t.co/wivMq47hx7

It was an honor to welcome several Balkan Heads of State to the Hope Hotel at @WrightPattAFB — the historic site of the Dayton Peace Accords 30 years ago.

That landmark agreement ended the Bosnian War and brought peace to a region long scarred by conflict.

As we commemorate the Peace Accords at @NATODayton2025, we reaffirm our commitment to strengthening transatlantic partnerships in pursuit of peace, freedom, and democracy.

What an incredible honor to welcome the marching band from Belmont High School — my alma mater — to Riverscape during @NATODayton2025.

Your performance was outstanding and made Dayton proud.

Thank you for being part of this historic weekend! https://t.co/k3p7EtXtxr

It was a privilege to participate in today's Opening Ceremony for @NATODayton2025. 

As we mark the 30th anniversary of the Dayton Peace Accords, this gathering stands as a powerful testament to the strength of this transatlantic alliance and our unwavering commitment to security, democracy, and international cooperation.

I extend a warm welcome to the distinguished parliamentarians and delegates representing our NATO allies and partners.

🚨 TUNE IN 🚨

I’m pleased to officially open @NATODayton2025.

Honored to kick off this important gathering of allies and partners.
https://t.co/TRQXcQZFb0

Honored to introduce @USAmbNATO, @RepRickLarsen, and @DrNealDunnFL2 for a panel discussion on NATO’s vital role in protecting U.S. national security and advancing the interests of the American people. https://t.co/YSBGqPPNuJ

Today, I joined Dayton Mayor @MayorMims and NATO PA President @MarcosPerestre1 to officially open @NATODayton2025.

As we mark 30 years since the Dayton Peace Accords, may this Spring Session spark meaningful dialogue on international security, diplomacy, and our shared commitment to peace.

It was my honor to welcome Željko Komšić, Member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, upon his arrival at @DAY_IntlAirport for @NATODayton2025.

I look forward to meaningful conversations and working together to support peace, security, and democratic values. https://t.co/m0mao6he35

I am pleased to see that the manager’s amendment removes an unfair provision recalculating federal pension benefits.

This is a victory for fairness and for the federal employees who keep our government running every day.

These benefits have been earned.

I will continue working to ensure that future efforts to rein in spending are focused on eliminating waste, fraud, and abuse – not on breaking our commitments to America's workforce.

Tomorrow, we officially kick off @NATODayton2025 — the first NATO Parliamentary Assembly held on American soil in 20 years.

Hundreds of parliamentarians will descend upon Dayton for this momentous occasion as we commemorate the 30th anniversary of the Dayton Peace Accords.

There has never been a more critical time to reassert America’s leadership. And there is no better place to do so than in Dayton.

I am proud to welcome our allies and partners to the Miami Valley.
https://t.co/KCmEoWs3Uu

I am heartbroken by the passing of my friend and colleague, Congressman Gerry Connolly.

Over the years, Gerry and I developed a strong friendship through our service together as members of the U.S. delegation to @NATOPAPress.

Gerry’s legacy is one of intellect, integrity, and relentless dedication to the people of Virginia’s 11th District and to our allies abroad. His absence will be deeply felt, both in Congress and on the international stage.

My thoughts and prayers are with his family, staff, and all who had the privilege of working alongside him.

We are just one week away from @NATODayton2025!

Dayton is ready to welcome parliamentarians, officials, and guests from across the world. In one week, we will engage in dialogue focused on strengthening peace and security across the transatlantic alliance.

We are honored to participate in this momentous event and showcase our city to the world.

Today, I joined @RepMikeCarey, @RepTeresaLF, and @RepSarahElfreth to reintroduce bipartisan legislation that reauthorizes the Historical Preservation Fund for 10 years, providing funding for historical preservation projects in the Miami Valley and across the country.

https://t.co/ZzQItc3Ary

Today, on Military Spouses Appreciation Day, we recognize the strength, sacrifice, and unwavering support of the spouses who stand behind our service members.

Your resilience on the home front makes our national defense possible.

Thank you for all that you do. https://t.co/32x4kmLQzW

I extend my heartfelt congratulations to His Holiness Pope Leo XIV on his appointment to serve as the 267th Bishop of Rome – the first American pope in history.

As he begins his papacy, I join millions around the world in prayer for his strength, wisdom, and leadership. 

I look forward to watching Pope Leo XIV continue to champion the cause of the poor and most vulnerable, and to his efforts in advancing peace, compassion, and human dignity.

🚨 TUNE IN 🚨

I’m joining @JakeTapper live in-studio.

Watch our conversation on @CNN. https://t.co/1Uw4qJKSSt

Thank you to all of the talented students who participated in the #OH10 2025 Congressional Art Competition. I'm continually impressed by the creativity and skill of the young artists in the Miami Valley.

Congratulations to Ravyn Strozier, whose drawing “As Sweet as a Honey Bee” was selected as this year's winner!

Special thanks to @DaytonArt for making this event a resounding success each year.

Iran can never be allowed to obtain a nuclear weapon.

That should be the cornerstone of U.S. foreign policy toward Iran.

Today on @FacetheNation, I told @MargBrennan that President Trump is continuing to enforce the maximum pressure campaign on Iran that he began in his first term.

🚨 HAPPENING NOW 🚨

I’m joining @MargBrennan on @FaceTheNation.

The goal of reconciliation should be to reduce overall government spending by eliminating waste, fraud, and abuse and reducing needless and unnecessary spending.

I oppose any and all efforts to reduce federal spending by taking money from the hard-earned pensions of federal workers.

Employee benefits are not a gift. They are earned.

I will not support and will not vote for the Oversight Committee's current budget reconciliation proposal reducing earned pension benefits for current federal employees.

.@GerryConnolly has had a stellar career serving the people of Virginia's 11th district. 

He has been relentless in his pursuit of establishing a Centre for Democratic Resilience at @NATO headquarters, which will recognize the importance of strengthening democratic institutions across NATO allies and partner nations. 

My prayers are with him and his family as he courageously battles this terrible disease.

Great to visit with the Montgomery County Student Advisory Delegation today and discuss the upcoming @NATODayton2025 summit.

 The next generation of leaders is thoughtful, capable, and committed — our community is in good hands. https://t.co/gERqLTezBc

I was honored to attend the ribbon-cutting ceremony for the newly renovated East End Community Services facility.

Their work has helped the lives of countless children in Dayton. This updated facility will enable East End to expand their services and allow them to assist more families in need.

Today, I had the honor of announcing that the Old Montgomery County Courthouse will be transformed into a special historical exhibit for @NATODayton2025.

This exhibit will showcase both Dayton's natural history as well as Dayton's historical impact on the world. 

This exhibit will be open to the public on Tuesday, May 27 and Wednesday, May 28 following the NATO Assembly, so that everyone can see pieces from Dayton's history.

We’re just one month out from @NATODayton2025!

Dayton is proud to welcome parliamentarians, officials, and guests from around the world for a week of dialogue focused on strengthening peace and security across the transatlantic alliance.

We can’t wait to showcase our city on the world stage. #Dayton2025

I am saddened by the passing of Pope Francis, whose unwavering compassion, humility, and dedication to service touched the lives of millions around the world.

If you are a high school student interested in attending @WestPoint_USMA, @NavalAcademy, @AF_Academy, @USCGAcademy, and @USMMAo, come on out to learn more information on how to apply!

The United States must maintain the position of Supreme Allied Commander Europe, who oversees and controls our nuclear weapons deterrent on the continent.

American troops are stationed in Europe, working to advance U.S. national security missions alongside our allies across the globe.

Strong American leadership in NATO is essential to deterring threats and defending our nation.

Today, I joined @UnivofDayton President Eric Spina in announcing public forum programming at UD on the sidelines of @NATODayton2025.

The programming will feature thought-based discussions with high-level elected officials, security and policy experts, and local leaders from across the @NATO countries with a focus on the historic Dayton Peace Accords and the need for the transatlantic alliance to work together towards a lasting peace moving forward.

President Trump has made clear that Vladimir Putin must stop bombing and killing Ukrainian civilians.

If Putin does not, then there will be severe consequences for Russia.

I told @CaitrionaPerry on @BBCNews that yesterday's conversation between President Trump and Putin is a step in the right direction toward delivering lasting peace in the region.

For over 20 years, @MarchMadnessMBB has tipped off in Dayton, and we’re proud to continue that tradition this week!

Last year, I led a bipartisan effort urging the @NCAA Division I Men’s Basketball Committee to keep the 'First Four' at the @UnivofDayton—and they extended it through 2028.

Tonight, we welcome the teams competing in the 'First Four,' celebrating our community’s passion for basketball and showcasing why Dayton is the perfect host for March Madness!

Houthi attacks have disrupted 75% of U.S. and U.K. commercial traffic through the Red Sea.

Iran has supported the Houthis and supplied them with weapons to continue attacking commercial vessels.

Today, I told @WolfBlitzer on @CNNSitRoom that it’s within the Trump Administration’s right to put pressure on Iran and take decisive military action against the Houthis to restore safe commercial traffic in the Red Sea.

Happy St. Patrick’s Day! Today, we celebrate Irish heritage, the contributions of Irish Americans, and the strong ties between the U.S. and Ireland. Wishing everyone in #OH10 and across the country a joyous and safe holiday! ☘️ https://t.co/QL3haD9MY0

The United States has put forward a ceasefire proposal, and so far, Russia is refusing to accept it.

President Trump has said he is willing to put pressure on Vladimir Putin to accept the terms or face increased sanctions.

Today, I told @JakeTapper on @TheLeadCNN that Putin doesn’t have many options but to come to the table and get on board with this agreement.

Milorad Dodik is working to dismantle the Dayton Peace Accords and undermine 30 years of fragile peace in the Balkans. 

Now, he's turning to Vladimir Putin to further destabilize the region — defying the judicial process and threatening Republika Srpska’s secession from Bosnia and Herzegovina.

We cannot let them succeed. As head of the U.S. delegation to @NATOPAPress, it is incumbent upon the U.S. and our allies to advance peace and stability in BiH.

Today marks 75 days until @NATODayton2025!

We are incredibly excited to showcase Dayton’s readiness to host this significant international assembly.

Instead, President Zelensky demanded security guarantees as a precondition for peace negotiations.

Happy Birthday, Ohio!

On this day in 1803, Ohio became the 17th state to join the Union. From the birthplace of aviation to a proud tradition of innovation, industry, and service, Ohioans have always led the way.

Here’s to 222 years of Ohio excellence — past, present, and future!

Ensuring access to necessary medical care for individuals awaiting trial is not just a matter of fairness— it’s a matter of public safety and fiscal responsibility.

I'm proud to reintroduce the Due Process Continuity of Care Act with @RepSTurner, @RepRutherfordFL, and @RepPaulTonko, which will provide a practical solution for preventing untreated health conditions from escalating, reducing burdens on local law enforcement, and helping communities avoid higher long-term costs.

Make no mistake – this conflict represents a battle between authoritarianism and democracy, and democracy must prevail.

Today, the House of Representatives passed the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year 2025.

The FY25 NDAA:

✅ Authorizes $9.2 million for Planning and Design toward construction of the Advanced Materials Research Laboratory of the Air Force Research Laboratory at Wright-Patterson AFB.

✅ Supports a 14.5 percent pay raise for junior enlisted servicemembers and a 4.5 percent pay raise for all other servicemembers.

✅ Improves U.S. missile defense capabilities against long-range threats by establishing an additional missile defense site on the East Coast.

This year’s NDAA authorizes over $60 million for projects at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, further reinforcing the Miami Valley’s critical role in our nation’s defense and security.

Secretary General Stoltenberg oversaw the enlargement of NATO, including the Alliance’s newest members, Finland and Sweden. As the international community turns its eyes to Dayton, we’re beyond excited to showcase our rejuvenated and revitalized downtown to @NATOPAPress next spring.

Great to hear that the “First Four” is staying in Dayton, Ohio!

For more than twenty years, @MarchMadnessMBB’s has had its tip-off in the Miami Valley.

Earlier this year, I sent a bipartisan letter to the NCAA Division I Men’s Basketball Committee urging them to continue hosting the “First Four” games at the @UnivofDayton.

The “First Four” is an incredible showcase of our community and love of basketball. It brings economic opportunities to our region, and as Dayton’s congressman and former mayor, I will continue to support to continue this wonderful tradition.
